resources.string: Google Maps and Google Places API

On a bustling street in the city centre, this down-to-earth budget hotel in a redbrick building is a 16-minute walk from Harare Gardens and 1 km from Harare Train Station.Featuring high ceilings, the airy, streamlined rooms come with Wi-Fi access, and tea and coffeemaking facilities, as well as en suite bathrooms.

Complimentary breakfast is served in 1 of 3 casual restaurants. Thereâ€™s a casino on-site, as well as a conference centre, a gym and a lounge bar. Other amenities include a tennis court, 2 outdoor pools (1 for kids) and event space. Beauty and massage services are offered. Parking is available.
Cnr Samora Machel & Park Street, Harare, 0, Zimbabwe
Rainbow Towers Hotel And Conference Centre

On the outskirts of downtown, this relaxed business hotel is 4 km from Harare Train Station, and less than 1 km from exhibits at the Museum of Human Sciences, which features a library.Laid-back rooms offer free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs, tea and coffeemakers, and minifridges, plus safes and en suite bathrooms

Set a block from the Harahe Gardens, this relaxed hotel is a 5-minute walk from the National Gallery of Zimbabwe. Baronscourt bus station is 1 km away.The casual rooms offer TV and en suite bathrooms, in addition to tea and coffeemaking facilities. Room service is available 24/7.
88 Kwame Nkrumah Ave Box 872, Livingstone, Harare, Zimbabwe

Housed in a low-rise, Colonial-style building surrounded by gardens, this refined hotel is a 14-minute walk from the National Gallery of Zimbabwe and 2 km from Harare train station.Elegant rooms have terraces or balconies overlooking gardens, and offer free Wi-Fi, satellite TV, and tea and coffeemaking facilities. Suites add sitting areas and minibars. Room service is available

On the outskirts of downtown, this relaxed business hotel is 4 km from Harare Train Station, and less than 1 km from exhibits at the Museum of Human Sciences, which features a library.Laid-back rooms offer free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TVs, tea and coffeemakers, and minifridges, plus safes and en suite bathrooms
Freshly fried hot chips, excellently roasted chicken with the trademark chicken inn flavour. The road leading to this eat house is wide so it\'s easily accessible.
Upbeat gallery exhibiting brilliant contemporary artist mostly upcoming artists from Zimbabwe but also different artists from all over africa as well.

Njelele continues to positively contribute to the Zimbabwean art scene through its presence in harare\'s down town in the CBD; its residences, exhibitions and conversation. It\'s always a good time in creative hub! Great networking space too!
The terminal is well organised, wide range of selection as far as the buses are concerned. The security is also very good ( the atmosphere is okay)

Popular rank in Harare CBD. Veru popular with commuters to the western suburbs of Harare. Awaya very busy and to many touts. All buses are available and easy to commute. One can not get stuck in town as they is also a shuttle service linking this to other centers.
More convenient for students travelling to University of Zimbabwe
Where you get transport for southern suburbs of Harare.

Very busy place and easily accessible from all directions. The place has buses to most major destinations to the southern suburbs also a shuttle service available to link the city centre and other bus terminals in the city. Crowded place but manageable. The entrance can be a bit tricky for the handicapped but quite accessible.
Fairly priced goods and services. When the job is you are guaranteed of the best. May need to increase human resources to reduce on waiting time for customers. Time factor.
Corner Cripps &, Seke Rd, Harare, Zimbabwe
Their furniture is of good quality and even in this unstable environment, their prices are relatively stable and reasonable.
Shop 108, Sam Levy\'s Village, Borrowdale, Harare, Zimbabwe
Great Sunday morning walks in the heart of nature and burst of fresh air. 3km, 5km, 8km and 10km marked trails Like Share

Code Wizards is Zimbabweâ€™s biggest recruitment event for final year engineering and MCA students. This edition of Code Wizards aims to get 75k+ students and 40k+ Registrations and 200+ colleges across Zimbabwe
TG3 celebrates the Code Divas/ Women in Technology. This mega property features 2 week long active engagement including code contests, webinars.
lets get together on the 23th of December and enjoy..see you there
The line up on the day will include Buffalo Souljah, Killer T, Jah Signal, Vabati VaJehova and others.Come and lets enjoy together
search for any place in Harare...

To ensure your images appear at their best on all screens, you should provide alternative bitmaps to match each screen density. For example, if your app provides bitmaps only for medium density (mdpi) screens, Android scales them up when on a high-density screen so that the image occupies the same physical space on the screen
